title: Highest margins
content: **Anil Basu**'s victory at Arambagh, WB had the largest margin CPM or any party had seen: over 5.9 lakh votes.

title: Lowest margins
content: On the other hand, **Som Marandi** (BJP) and **Konathala Ramakrishna** (INC) won by just 9 votes in Bihar, 1998 and AP, 1989 respectively.

title: Most voters
content: Until 2004, **Outer Delhi** had the highest number of voters polled (15 lakh). After the 2008 delimitation, that mantle went to **Malkajgiri, AP** (12 lakh)

title: Fewest voters
content: **Lakshadweep** has the lowest number of votes counted consistently across the years, with close competition from **Dadra & Nagar Haveli**.

title: Most candidates
content: **Nalgonda, AP** fielded a record-breaking 480 candidates in the 1996 elections, with **Belgaum, KA** a close second in the same year.

title: Uncontested wins
content: Since 1989, no election was won uncontested. **Srinagar, J&K** was the last, where Mohammad Shafi Bhat of JKN won without competition.

title: Most women
content: Only two elections had women candidates exclusively: **Karur, TN** (1967) and **Panskura, WB** (1977). Only 8 elections have had more women than men.

title: Old candidates
content: **Arif Ahmed Shaikh Jafhar** (NBNP) contested the 2009 elections from Dhhule, MH at age 99, making him the oldest candidate ever in India.
